ATRifle.name: 135 Neville Anti-Tank Rifle
ATRifle.description: The Neville is unmatched in its versatility as a portable, magazine-based anti-armor firearm.

ATRifleTripod.name: "Typhon" ra.XII
ATRifleTripod.description: This mounted anti-tank rifle boasts improved accuracy over its free-standing counterparts. The Typhon was specifically designed with shock absorption in mind, allowing for faster, more consistent firing patterns.

general: Equipped with a high velocity barrel that deals 20% extra damage per shot
This can be attached to certain vehicles

ATBonesawTripod.name: Bonesaw MK.3
ATBonesawTripod.description: This variant of the Bonesaw MK.3 is specially designed for use with tripod mounts. This affords it with increased stability and maximum potential range.

general: This can be attached to certain vehicles

ATBonesawHand.name: Bonesaw MK.3
ATBonesawHand.description: The pride of the Warden anti-armored arsenal, the Bonesaw Mk.3 has one job; to cut through heavy metal plating of Colonial tanks.

general: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles
Additional 100% chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

ATVenom.name: Venom c.II 35
ATVenom.description: The Venom RPG launcher fires anti-tank charges. Its simple design makes it easy to deploy, even in high-stakes operations.

general: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

ATBane.name: Bane 45
ATBane.description: This shoulder-mounted heavy launcher is the first of its kind. It features heavy blast shielding and is capable of launching anti-tank charges over relatively large distances.

general: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

AmmoATDirect.name: AP/RPG
AmmoATDirect.description: An armour piercing projectile used with specialized RPG launchers.

general: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

AmmoATIndirect.name: ARC/RPG
AmmoATIndirect.description: An anti-tank projectili fied from indirect RPG launchers.

general: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles
Additional 100% chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

FlamethrowerWilowsBane.name: Wilow's Bane Model 845
FlamethrowerWilowsBane.description: Named for the unfortunate trees harmed in the development of this highly destructive weapon, the Wilow's Bane utilizes flammable chemicals and fires them into a concentrated stream through an open flame. This liquid flame ignites Colonial emplacements and garrisons to route infantry while reducing their defenses to a pile of ash.
FlamethrowerWilowsBane.ammoUsed: Wilow's Bane Ammo, "Molten Wind" v.II Ammo

general: How'd you like your collies, original, or extra crispy?

FlamethrowerMoltenWind.name: "Molten Wind" v.II Flame Torch
FlamethrowerMoltenWind.description: Using a deadly mix of flammable gasses and chemical compounds, the "Molten Wind" is the Colonial Legion's most devastating infantry weapon. Employing ancient techniques, Mesean chemists developed a technique to stabilize and weaponize liquid flames, which quickly transform any flammable structure into a raging inferno.
FlamethrowerMoltenWind.ammoUsed: "Molten Wind" v.II Ammo, Wilow's Bane Ammo

GrenadeLauncher.name: KLG901-2 Lunaire F
GrenadeLauncher.description: A weapon designed to launch specialty grenades over long-distances. This modern Kraunian firearm uses advanced propulsion designed for increased efficiency due to overall weight of the weapon and projectiles.
GrenadeLauncher.ammoUsed: Green Ash Grenade, PT-815 Smoke Grenade, Tremola Grenade GPb-1

GrenadeLauncherTripod.name: Mounted Fissura gd.I
GrenadeLauncherTripod.description: Capable of firing different grenades, quickly and at long range, the Fissura gd.I is mobile enough for easy transport, while increasing the effectiveness of infantry ordinance.
GrenadeLauncherTripod.ammoUsed: Green Ash Grenade, PT-815 Smoke Grenade, Tremola Grenade GPb-1

general: This can be attached to certain vehicles

GrenadeTremola.name: Tremola Grenade GPb-1
GrenadeTremola.description: An explosive Estrllan grenade specially designed for use with handheld grenade launchers. This modern grenade boasts a large payload and is deadly to lingering infantry and structural supports.

MGRatcatcher.name: Malone Ratcatcher MK.1
MGRatcatcher.description: Early iterations of this machinegun were built to be emplaced in bunkers and on the decks of lightly armed warships, the Ratcatcher is Harvey Malone's first freely mountable infantry weapon designed for field use. Just like its predecessors, this heavy weapon suppresses enemy soldiers with unmatched efficiency.

general: This can be attached to certain vehicles

MGLamentum.name: Lamentum mm.IV
MGLamentum.description: Built on the bones of the first automatic weapons introduced to the Legion, the "Lamentum" mm.IV is still quite an intimidating force to encounter on the battlefield. Boasting a large magazine and impressive active range, this mounted machinegun excels at laying down consistent suppressive fire.

general: Equipped with a high velocity barrel that deals 50% extra damage per shot
This can be attached to certain vehicles

InfantrySupportGun.name: Daucus isg.III
InfantrySupportGun.description: This heavy infantry cannon requires a tripod for stability. The Daucus is designed to give infantry a foothold against enemy vehicles and light fortifications or established fortified garrisons.

AmmoShell30.name: 30mm
AmmoShell30.description: Standard explosive shell with certain small vehicles and infantry weapons

Mortar.name: Cremari Mortar
Mortar.description: This short-range cannon is designed to bombard enemy infantry with indirect fire.
Mortar.ammoUsed: Mortar Shell, Shrapnel Mortar Shell, Flare Mortar Shell

AmmoMortarFlare.name: Flare Mortar Shell
AmmoMortarFlare.description: A long-burning flare that ignites midair to illuminate a large area and reveals enemy targets.

AmmoMortarShrapnel.name: Shrapnel Mortar Shell
AmmoMortarShrapnel.description: A payload filled with shrapnel used with mortar tubes. Devestates nearby infantry.

AmmoMortarHE.name: Mortar Shell
AmmoMortarHE.description: An explosive payload used with mortar tubes.

GrenadeATFlask.name: BF5 White Ash Flask Grenade
GrenadeATFlask.description: An explosive flask used for melting enemy armor. This carefully designed liquid bomb explodes into a dazzling flash of molten debris upon impact.

general: High chance of disabling Track subsystem

ATIgnifist.name: Ignifist 30
ATIgnifist.description: This single-use rocket can be fired a short distance. Designed to punch holes into tanks, the Ignifist is the perfect tool for infantry anticipating armoured resitance.

general: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

GrenadeHE.name: Mammon 91-b
GrenadeHE.description: This densely packed, high-explosive grenade is designed to damage structures and vehicles.

GrenadeATSticky.name: Anti-Tank Sticky Bomb
GrenadeATSticky.description: An adherable grenade designed to penetrate heavy tank armor. The sticky bomb can only be thrown a short distance and is ineffective against structures.

general: High chance of disabling Track subsystem

RPGFoebreaker.name: Cutler Foebreaker
RPGFoebreaker.description: This unique duel-barrelled RPG launcher can fire two RPG shells in relatively quick succession. This increase in firepower makes it nearly impossible for a single soldier to operate without the support of a sturdy mount.

general: This can be attached to certain vehicles

RPGCutler.name: Cutler Launcher 4
RPGCutler.description: The Cutler Launcher is capable of firing and unguided, rocket-propelled grenade over short distances with startling efficiency. Its simple design allows for easy deployment and storage.

AmmoRPG.name: RPG
AmmoRPG.description: A fast-moving explosive projectile used with RPG launchers.
